review:
Go to my account today, have a message about cross-save, lost 90% of it, skins, event progress, level, Battle Pass locked lv 0 (I buy it and up it like 60..70...).... So where is the money/time/effort... I spent ?

BUT THANKS EA FOR THE 250$+ EVENT AND NOTHING FOR THE GAMEPLAY THIS SEASON !!

They're now abandoning character specific heirlooms and setting their sights on more hyper monetized content based on the new 'artifacts.'($360 per artifact) Yet they have still not addressed any of the game's issues like the audio vanishing faster than my father, the matchmaking consistently leading to steamrolls, or the servers that's made from something weaker than my will to exist. Maybe once they start solving their issues I'll change my review.

When I queue for duos don't make it switch to trios, also might as well mute enemy footsteps since teammates feet are 30x louder. PLEASE MAKE THE GAME LAG HARDER, I NEED TO LOSE A FIGHT BECAUSE THE GAME LAGS THE EXACT SECOND I START SHOOTING

EVERYONE THAT'S PART OF THIS DEBACLE SHOULD BE FIRED. Lets take a look.

Server = Terrible
AUDIO == What AUDIO?
CAS = Terrible
Ranked = Also Terrible
Hit Registration, dying behind closed doors , all part of the fun
Cosmetics = Call your bank and get the 2nd mortgage
Events= Eh
Characters = Good but unbalanced
Game play= When not crashing .. THE MOST ADDICTIVE EXPERIENCE 
Should you even download = NO
Support from the DEVS = LMAO

game is not entirely bad. new legends shake up the gameplay quite a bit, crafting banners and the reworks to the class system was a much needed improvement, and the grind is not entirely bad for those that don't really care about winning games or being the next biggest twitch streamer.

good game to wind down with if you are looking for a time to goof off with your buddies, or enjoy the titanfall universe

not better than titanfall, but good if you don't want to play titanfall

Apex Legends is not for casuals. 

Only professional gamers, streamers and sweatlords who desperately want to be streamers play Apex on a daily basis : If you aren't playing like them, you're gonna get destroyed pretty fucking hard, on every single confrotation. There is no room to think and planify. 

For all of them, every single aspect in Apex is taken so serious they feel entitled. They treated Apex Legends as a national esport; one wrong move (ex.: not landing on a high contested POIs), and you'll get verbally abused by your teammates. Thinking outside of the box is a blasphemy to them.

The MMR/SBMM/ whatever matchmaking Respawn is using is the worst experience ever : Unless you have amazing skills, you'll lose a series of matches in a row. 100% Guarantee. Then, the game will put you into an easier lobby so you get a couple of kills, and after that match, Respawn will send you to high skilled lobbies for you to lose more. Wow! What an amazing system, Respawn! So fair and balanced ! And of course, the fans are okay with this. "Protect the lower skilled players", my ass : Respawn's MMR takes those low skilled players to feed the more talented players and streamers, and I know, because I'm one of the low skilled players. Even with an overall 1K/D, Respawn will make sure you'll get fucked by better gamers against your skills, even you have the worst K/Ds, and you feel your skills aren't up to the challenges.

Speaking of matchmaking, every lobby, either pubs or ranked, feels like the biggest tournament even conceived : If you try to have fun in the lobby (by that, I mean not play the exact same way the progamers/streamers/sweaties are playing), you lose. Simple as that. And then when you try something else they don't like (ex.: play strategically with placements and loot), you'll receive toxic abuse. There is no middle ground in this game. As long as heirlooms recolours are selling high, Respawn seems okay with a toxic community.

It's sad, really, because the gameplay is one of the best FPS around: there is not another game close to what Apex is offering (except Titanfall 2, in some ways).

Having fun in a videogame is a foreign concept at Respawn, and its community as a whole seems to agree with the devs's vision.

If you're a casual, look somewhere else. Trust me, there are games deserve more your time than Apex Legends.

EDIT : Went back for one more season, and my review still stands. Matchmaking is garbage and Respawn really hates casual players. STAY AWAY FROM APEX LEGENDS.

Despite the removal of Arena Mode; I still love this game because it forces me to be the best player; most of all, the best shooter; because it takes great practice and skill to survive the world of apex.  So I highly recommend this to anyone who desires to be the best in survival.

Sep 2nd, 2023:
I don't often write reviews, but I feel compelled to express my disappointment with Season 18.

The matchmaking system is seriously flawed. In many instances, I find myself pitted against either low-level cheaters or seasoned predators, which has seriously hampered the enjoyment for my friends and me. And this is on non-Asian servers; I can only imagine what the experience would be like there.

Regarding the in-game shop and events, the offerings have been lackluster at best. It seems that Respawn and EA are attempting to recoup losses from Seasons 16 and 17, but the current state of the game provides little incentive for financial investment. This is coming from someone who has purchased over 1,200 gold skins and 22 heirlooms. If things continue this way, I foresee a significant decline in the player base, and it's disappointing that the developers don't seem to acknowledge this.

The gameplay itself has become so unbalanced that it encourages teaming, which in my view undermines the competitive nature of the game. It's evident that the studio's focus has shifted away from the needs and experiences of average players. I've decided to step back from the game for now and will consider returning once improvements have been made.

——From a greatly disappointed player

Are you out of your freaking mind??? WTF! WTF is this normal game mode!!! Do not force your customers to play shift!!! There is no loot!!!! And fix your freaking match making system!!! Previously, you had the decency to allow players to choose what to play, normal or some horseshift mode. This time?? What is wrong with you, Respawn????? STOP FEEDING US SHIFT !!!! Have you learnt nothing since the last time this game has died??? 

WHO is in you management team !!! WHO are your PROJECT MANAGERS ???
FIRE THEM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
They Clearly do NOT know SHIFT !!!!!!

Yes, I still have not quit the game, haha. I started playing ranked though, and is currently at Silver III, why? Cause there's a bunch of PREDATORS in my SILVER Game!! Why? Cause the game is dead, lol.

October 18th, 2023

Haven't played this game in a while, my life seems to be much better. But God, WHY would I open this game again.... There are reasons maps are reworked, and these maps, SUCK!!!! It is clearly visible that EA and Respawn have data analysts, but they do not base their analysis on reality, but imagination. They should not be making these decisions!!!! Shift game, and I heard the ranked system for next season is built for cheaters, expect them coming, as if there weren't enough...

I mean it's an alright game, where there's just a learning curve. No paywalls so to speak, as the only thing you can really purchase is cosmetic. All in all, its a decent Battle Royale, can't complain.

One of the best, if not THE best BR game out there.

Biggest issue is the "skill based matchmaking." which is total BS because all the top dogs use VPNs and will just stomp you. 
If you havent been playing since day 1, and EVERY SINGLE ****ING DAY SINCE. Good luck staying competitive.

Other than almost winning a match and getting kicked for game error, while also receiving a 10 minute penalty from the game auto abandoning(due to game error) its an alright game...

Amount of Times x [4] 
40 mins (Lost Time)

Unplayable via Steam, corrupts your save on load and makes the damn thing unlaunchable via any method. Not that im missing out on much adding so much garbage like making voice lines 'gender neutral'. Stay away from this sweatfest and show Respawn that Titanfall 3 was what everyone wanted not this horrible woke garbage game.

I love this game, solo q is rough if you're trying to rank up, but the movement of Respawn's games have always been amazing. 

I cannot recommend this game to new players. Even with the addition of the intro lobbies that are supposed to be new user friendly (i.e., filled with bots) as soon as you're out of it you **will** get stomped by high ranking pred's and master ranked players regardless of the game mode. The learning curve is steep and the community makes it steeper. Smurfing is rampant and always will be, and even if it weren't an issue, matchmaking will always put you in lobbies with someone who's macros and soft aim bot make them impossible to hit while they're zeroed in on your forehead or predator ranked players. 

If you're playing with friends, it gets worse because matchmaking also prioritizes putting you with other 3 stacks (who are all usually Master or higher)

I played this game since release, loved it then until the hacks took over. If you can stand playing against peeps that run faster, jump higher, move quicker , have aimbot and see thru walls then this is the game for you.  Otherwise prepare to be disappointed cause the game sure don't care about the hacks and the hacks have no shame in using them.  Shame really as this was and could be again the ultimate pvp game.

Respawn's gunplay and movement are simply unmatched. No other game on the market except for maybe Call of Duty has guns that sound, feel, and look as good as the guns in Apex. It simply feels really nice to shoot things in Apex. It's truly the best of what the FPS genre has to offer. However, here's a big and stinky but: EA. These two letters, when put next to each other, strike fear into the hearts of five generations of gamers. The game is currently riddled with bugs, hackers, a scam-dominated meta, stale game modes, piss-poor matchmaking, and more. What does EA make respawn focus on instead? Pumping out more skins and collection events. This season is the most egregious one so far in this regard, with recolored skins littering the shop and events. Meanwhile, Mobile has 3 more legends than us, a highly - and I mean HIGHLY - requested team deathmatch mode, and tons of other cool features that the console/PC versions can only have wet dreams about. Thank you EA. You truly have the reverse Midas touch, where everything you touch turns into piles of doodoo.

Apex Legends is a disappointing game that fails to live up to the hype. The graphics are bland and uninspired, the controls are clunky and unresponsive, and the gameplay is repetitive and boring. The selection of weapons and characters is limited, and the matchmaking system is unreliable, frequently matching players with people who are much higher or lower level than they are. The in-game microtransactions are also a major problem, as players are constantly bombarded with ads for new skins, weapons, and other cosmetic items. Overall, I wouldn't recommend Apex Legends to anyone looking for a fun and engaging multiplayer experience.

Respawn is not the same company that made Titanfall 2 anymore. This is published by EA so you know there's no real progression unless you spend ungodly amounts of money for skins that don't look good. You would think for a game with such good movement, EA would realize how good this game could be. Unfortunately the pros in this game aren't good enough to move to another game, and any new players immediately leave because this game also lags like crazy. There is literally no reason to play this game. I have played it since launch, and it's not like it's gotten a 2.0 or health update to the game. I'm begging you, please just don't play this game. But if you do, add me I guess.

Preface: I do recommend this game - Only for short lengths of time. Maybe an hour or two TOPS. Any more than that and you run the risk of rage quitting and uninstalling due to one or more of the issues I list below. You have been warned.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This game has now been around for over 2 years. PLENTY of time for the developers to establish a trusting relationship with their players/users. Typically, that is what a decent developer does: A swath of players will complain about a certain aspect of the game and the developers will actually listen and at least make attempts at fixing the problems.

NOT. IN. THIS. CASE. EVER.

I understand that a portion of what a game developing company does is supposed to generate revenue for the company - And they do! A separate, and equally important, aspect is that the company is also supposed to improve the game by listening to their users and addressing issues in a timely manner - hopefully, before their users get angry enough to drop the game altogether.

This is precisely where EA/Respawn have failed. And I will break it down for you, precisely HOW they have failed.

1. Cheaters:
This game has an inordinate amount of cheaters. There really is no easy way to say it. And it is OBVIOUS and BLATANT. EA relies upon the absolutely defunct Easy Anti-Cheat system. Please, hold your laughter... In their defense, however, they have made sure to spread rumors of a revamped anti-cheat system, designed specifically for Apex. The real issue is how LONG they have been spreading this rumor. I can only assume that it was a PR stunt to quiet those complaints of cheaters. How can I make that assumption? Mainly because they seem to focus on things of little or no consequence - Like adding badges to shield batteries and medkits... I mean, what?! Why would you focus on cosmetics when you have a huge cheater problem?!

2. Match-Making (MM):
Very rarely have I seen an MM quite as laughable as the one being used in Apex. I understand that there it a lot of complexity involved, what with ranked splits resetting every month (for the most part) and making everyone, essentially, noobs. But, there is a SUPER easy way to fix it (which I will detail later). I understand why they do the ranked split as well: they want to force players to play more often to keep their ranking high - DUH! The more players there are, the more likely it is that they make money and that those players will spread the word so that even more players will play and give them even more opportunity to make more money. But an MM based solely on your current in-game rank is absolutely asinine. And that is just ranked. What if you don't play ranked? Good luck! You could be paired against ANYONE, professional players and noobs alike.

3. Maps:
Currently, there are a total of five maps in Apex (for BR). Every season they have two maps in rotation for pub games. TWO. And those two maps rotate every hour or so. For ranked matches, they use ONE. Over and over, on and on... Maps should be randomized except in tournaments. Going into a game, you should not know where you are going to land, what characters you should be playing, etc. It should be a friggin' BATTLE ROYALE! Formulate your plan based on who is on your team and what the map is, ad-hoc, just like everyone else. No one should know what map your're landing on until the drop ship starts its flight across it. Add some aspect mystery to the game.

4. Weapons:
There is a good selection of weapons in the game, but the real issue is with practicality. Take, for instance, the so-called top sniper rifle in the game - the Kraber. It's supposed to be a .50-cal sniper rifle. It LOOKS great, but that's where the good news ends. If you hop into the firing range and test out all of the sniper rifles available to you, you will catch the glaring issues. The Sentinel, the Longbow, and the Charge Rifle all use sniper rounds (NOT a .50; Something smaller like a .308). All three can reach WAY out and touch your enemy. The Charge Rifle can literally reach all the way across an area of the map - over 800m. The Sentinel and Longbow can shoot pretty accurately to 400+m (depends on optics in use, graphics, screen size, FOV, etc). With the Kraber, the bullet starts dropping wildly at just 200m. Yeah...the highest-powered weapon in the game, using the highest-caliber bullet can BARELY eke out a 400m hit with accuracy. Let's add to this the 30-30 Repeater and the G7 Scout - A heavy ammo, medium range pew-pew and light ammo medium range pew-pew, respectively. Both of these rifles can out-shoot the Kraber with accuracy. WHY? And the Charge Rifle - Why does this not use energy ammo? I mean...CHARGE Rifle...it shoots a beam of light!...sigh...

5. Legends:
Don't get me wrong, there is a use for every single legend in the game. Whether it be for hiding, sniping, guarding, tracking...it's useful stuff. It is also getting really out of hand. First, how many freaking legends does a game like this need? At some point in the near future, you could probably have a pub match where every single player in the game is a different legend. I'm not even joking though I wish I were. Second, when EA unveils a new legend, they typically add it to the game and then they forget its existence. No re-balancing of legends, no fixing bugs, etc. And if they DO fix something with a legend, it is usually a heavy-handed nerf beyond what anyone that actually PLAYS the game was expecting. The abilities of the legends are pretty unique, but the overall effect of those abilities is copied across other legends. The exception to this is both Loba and Lifeline. Loba has her black market (so you don't have to hunt around an area if you know what you are looking for) and Lifeline has her health drone - The only legend that can heal your flesh-wounds. Other than those two, you can pretty much classify all other legends into categories like defense, offense, or recon and their abilities, while varied, have ultimately the same effect on the game. Offense legends can quickly get up in your face and kill you, defense legends can slow your entry into an area while sapping your health, and recon legends can track you and your team down. Simple. And boring too. Meh.

On to my ideas on how we can fix BOTH the cheater AND MM issues in Apex:

1. New DB table - Player AVG DMG (>10) Last 10 Games (PAD).

2. New DB table - Player AVG DMG Rating (PADR); 11-300: Rating 0; 301-700: Rating 1; 701-1200: Rating 2; 1201-2000: Rating 3; 2001-3200: Rating 4; 3201-4200: Rating 5 (AND account marked for review); 4200+: Rating 6 (Insta-banned - If the pros can't do it, pubs can't either without cheating).

*NOTE - Keep in mind that these are averaged over the last TEN games where damage done was greater than 10.

3. Players can only be matched with other players of the same PADR -/+1.

4. Teams have an AVG DMG Rating (TADR) of ((PADR1+PADR2+PADR3)/3)-1 (always rounded UP) for BR Trios. 1 player with R2, 2 players with R3 would be ((R2+R3+R3)/3)-1=R2. Teams can only be matched with other teams of the same TADR.

THREE birds, one stone. Fix MM, catch a boatload of cheaters, AND the games are more fun because you are playing with players very close to your own skill level instead of non-stop sweats OR non-stop noobs.

*I'm not saying it is not possible to play a 4K+ DMG game. I AM saying it IS impossible to play 10 *consecutive* 4K+ DMG games without cheating. Again, if the pros can't do it, neither can the pubs without programmatic assistance (cheating).

Valorant meets Fortnite? Didn't like Valorant and haven't played Fortnite, yet I strangely like battle royales (like CS:GO's Danger Zone). So far I'm entertained, so now I just have to put hundreds or thousands of hours into it :(

Edit: Fast-paced fun. 10/10 would recommend if you like battle royales, and if not or you don't know, just try it. I got half of the purchasable Legends randomly for free (I did not spend any in-game currency or real money). Achievements are also easy to get. Lastly, please do not leave the match if you get downed and use a mic if you have one, thank you :)

I thought the game would be fun, even bought the character package as a start.... 2.1 hours in, not a single kill, and I only managed to get in around 13 minutes on one match because we didn't land in a popular spot.  There is absolutely no learning curve, you're either good at the start or you're wasting your time in queue for no reason.   
   I don't, won't, and can't see recommending a game that doesn't provide matchmaking for similar experience levels.  I made it to level 2, going against level 130's, or even level 20's is downright slaughter.  As stated, you're either already good at the game or it's a waste of time and/or money.

Amazing BR that is not just reliant on gun skill. There's loads of variety in terms of how you play. Great social game if you have a steady set of friends for squadding up. Also doesn't have the toxic COD fragile ego thing.

omg. i love apex  so much. dear whoever made the game, your game saved me. i find myself sick a lot and to pass the time i play this game. 10/10 i can't think of any other game that has had me more active then this one. love it

Favorite battle royale, the one multiplayer game that I enjoy even when I am not doing well in it. Fun immersive characters, changing the game enough every few months to keep it fresh and interesting, much different from Warzone. which I played before that made me burst blood vessels every time I instantly died from walking into the wrong room or outside or anywhere. You have lots of health and shields in this, also abilities. You don't die easy so when ever I lose it's no big deal. I accept it as a fair fight. Not just that scenario when you walk into a room where an all black skin is in a corner with a gun that kills you in 0.0001 seconds giving you absolutely no time what so ever to react. Apex is a great game

I once got strafe jumped into a wall bounce while being no scoped by a what I believed was a wraith travelling at approximately 400kmph all before I could find a gun after searching through like 7 loot bins it was at that moment I decided trios was indeed to hard and went back to ranked

this game has become utter dog shit. played since season 0, they refuse to fix anything. they will only continue to add stupid shit that little timmy can spend his allowance on. tragic fucking match making, tragic fucking servers, tragic fucking legends with nothing but wall hack and scan abilities...all your devs rode the short bus to school. never have i played a game where i see blood splatter, hear bullets hit flesh, hear bullets hit armor, but am not rewarded for any damage. that has become more constant then anything. lack of hit reg is more consistent than your hit reg. played your game on 3 different platforms from console to mediocre pc to really nice pc, the same things are always present. stop catering to retards with joy sticks, we know with out aim assist you wouldnt sell anything and timmy wouldnt hit the broad side of a barn. oh for all you controller on pc warriors, your just a crutch gaymer.

this game consistently gets worse and worse every fucking season. i love the bias hit reg and the fact you cater to fucking dick backs with controllers. dog shit game, why anyone would play this is beyond me.

This games aight. Too many sweats and rats these days. 9/10 times you will die to someone hiding in a corner or insta-beams you with an R301. Aiming in this game is unlike most games. This game you have to violently shake your mouse and pray you kill someone. Then there is the MOVEMENT. Holy goddamn movement. PISSES ME OFF.

So I recommend this game, mostly because of the battle royales out, you get the most consistent experience out of Apex Legends. The lore you get also is an added nice touch. The game has it's ups and downs depending on the season and meta. Usually each season has it's own feels but the biggest thing is it feels too many times there is too much focus on the next event and the skins to purchase. However it's still fun to jump on and play, especially with friends. Take it with a grain of salt, and jump in and play.

BOUGHT THE CHAMPIONS EDITION AND THE GAME DOESNT WANT TO CONNECT. NOT ONLY THAT, i CANT REQUEST A REFUND. TRIED EVERYTHING TO CONNECT, AND ITS STUCK ON THE MAIN LOADING SCREEN SAYING SAVIORS. I WISH THE SAVIORS SAVED ME FROM WASTING MY MONEY. JUST AVOID.

Game is fun as hell for all ages. Even if you have a full time job or havent been around the gaming scene for a while, this game has something to keep you interested and feels like the skill gap isnt as bad as some other BR's

Out of most free-to-play battle royales, that I have played, none come close to Apex's movement mechanics and versatility when it comes to necessity of game-sense in competitive play. An added bonus is the p2w gun skins and design team's obvious skill.

The best battle royale in my humble opinion. There's no excess building component that only children have time to master. This game is great to launch every now and again if you have nothing better to play.

ZERO customer support, lots of bugs, game encourages hide/camp strategies and has a number of overpowered skins  that modify the sights to be tighter. The "Ranked" mode crashes regularly and players DC from servers A LOT. Regularly playing Ranked games with disadvantaged team. Game is unplayable since Season 13 release. (Update: New Engine errors crashing the game after patching!) DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU HAVE A 3090 gfx card. It will simply crash constantly.

The game was great but is slowly losing its uniqueness, plus they keep changing things besides adding content, its not as fun as it was, but my favorite fps mechanic wise. Im a movement player and movement is what makes this game different

10/10 (exceptional. like... bring-a-damn-tear-to-your-eye good)

One of the most intense FPS multiplayer PVP games you'll ever play. Rich environment, steps made in optimzation for the genre that were absolutely ground-breaking at the time. This game improved the battle royale genre as a whole and paved the way for better optimized successors. A staple of the battle royale PVP genre. Super interesting heroes with sweet abilities. Gun play that will make you HNNNNGGG. and high-flying action that can be intense until the last second. So many fond memories with friends. And more being created every day. Saying I recommend this game would be an understatement.

MMMM.. apex.  If you're not into it now, don't ever.  You'll regret it.  It ruins your wallet, it takes up your life... before you know it you'll have 1k hours gone and only a master badge to show for it.

Apex is a free game. THATS IT!
DO NOT PUT ANY MONEY FOR COSMETICS. EA DOESN'T CARE AND WILL NOT HELP RECOVER STOLEN ACCOUNTS.
It will always be a free game, because security sucks, the game is bugged 300 days out of 365, hackers in ranked, and shit ton of other issues. IT IS NOT WORTH SPENDING A PENNY. Even after spending close to $300 on in game cosmetics, EA says its not their responsibility that my account got hacked, when it was EA support who handed my account over to an unknown person.
Play for free. DO NOT SPEND ANY MONEY ON APEX

The one big issues here are 1) Easy Anti-cheat, which is absolute garbage. It doesn't work in R6 Siege and it doesn't work here either. 2) This game gets so much money and attention it feels like there's a lot of focus on this instead of giving us Titanfall 3, which is what the fans really want. And finally 3) the matchmaking has somehow taken a turn for the worse. I get that BRs are big lobbies, but this is one of the most played games on Steam and for some reason I find absolute killers in bronze and silver lobbies. Why am I in a game with a Predator 3 stack as a Bronze 2? I have no idea, but it's happened several times and it's clear that the devs are in no rush to fix it. Hopefully they're putting in some serious work on something else entirely, I'm done with this one.

A great game with subtle team and FPS dynamics that really rewards great players, but in such a way that you can have a great time with friends even if y'all are losing. The only two things I dislike: wait times between matches and quitters . . .

One of the best Battle Royales released to date.  This game is a tonne of fun, even if it can be super frustrating at times.

There is just something about the gun play in the game that makes it soooo satisfying when you absolutely fry someone.

I know, I know EA is greedy and all, but you can actually earn things by playing this game.

Gameplay is solid, Graphics are good ... been playing this game on multiple account since day one.

Not gonna lie first few seasons were kinda rough, still till this day some of season lvls are completely useless and ugly skins. but overall I like if you buy one season and go through all of the lvls you can use the coins (earned by lvling up through the season) again for new season.

Overall 

[ GAMEPLAY ]           IS SOLID
[ GRAPHICS  ]           IS GOOD
[ PERFORMANCE ]   VERY OPTIMIZED
[ SOUND/AUDIO ]    SOMETIMES BUGGY, OVERALL GOOD
[ IS IT P2W]             HELL NAAA

that's it hopes you liked it and found it usefull.

I like it. Sure it has its imperfections but what game doesn't. I mean look at how many hours I put into it. I obviously like it. Designs of both Character models and maps look great. Its also a great game to stream. 
Also here's my plug: https://www.twitch.tv/shinahbae

Bugs, more bugs, in the lobby bugs, in-game bugs, garbage servers, more and more cheaters (aimbots...wallhacks...you name it), questionable design/game mechanics...the usual BR scene after X amount of time. Apex could be great - there are aspects to it that are fantastic such as the movement, the variety of legends and weapons to choose from, even the colour palette and map design (for the most part)...but the bugs, the poor servers and the cheaters are going to be its eventual downfall if Respawn doesn't get its act together soon, especially with new FPS games on the horizon. Personally, I could never get over the bizarre choice to have punches deal absurd damage (at least early game with white/blue armour) while 10-20 rounds of light/heavy ammo more or less hits for the same amount. It's a weird, one-step-too-far case of 'jumping the shark' or 'nuking the fridge' that's been in the game since day 1.

The fundamental mechanics of the game is also clearly conducive to 3rd party opportunism from the get-go and, once past the mid-game stage, serves up Gold/Red shield bullet-sponge fiestas ad nauseam. More often than not I have more fun in the early stages of a game when white/blue and maybe the odd purple armour is mostly all you see. I'm inclined to think that the game would be less tedious if Respawn had stopped at Purple or Gold armour (the latter being very rare). 

Ultimately though, for all of its good qualities, Apex just isn't hitting the mark for me anymore. The bugs, the bad servers and the bypassed Easy anti-cheat just makes for a BR that could be great, but often serves up a disappointing experience that is more of a miss than a hit. As always though, your mileage may vary.

I started the game to play with a friend of mine just as a joke but after getting to lvl 56 on PS4 i decided to download it on my new pc too i mean i almost reached lvl 50 again within a week and well i got myself the starter character pack as well as the Loba edition its all worth it in my opinion.!



so upgrade 400 something hours in so 330 more than at my last review and i still love it

it is good game i got this as a gift and the only 2 problems i have is certain weapons and legends/characters are obviously better than others and it has a VERY HARD learning curve but if your able to get past the curve its pretty fun 8/10

The game actually provides a challenge, I've played sense the early days on console and now on pc and this game still has never gotten old, and i very rarely even run into a hacker. Great game and fun to stream!

a plausible Respawn patch scenario:

add setting to the options menu which allows you to tweak anti aliasing very slightly;
new setting causes a quarter of the apex population's account to be reset to level 1

just Respawn things.

This is the best BR out there. In fact, it's the only one I can stand playing. That said, it's surprising how broken the matchmaking for ranked is lately given how well funded this game is, or should be. About 20% of my time in ranked, I join with 1 or 2 missing people from my squad. My chances of winning drop dramatically. And playing randoms in pubs is well...frustrating. The result of this is I end up stopping after only a handful of games, either because MM'ing or the randoms I get matched with end up sabotaging the fun.

Unless you have a group you can consistently play  with or you're just extremely patient, I don't recommend this one.

Game was fun. Lots to learn & master. Game is unplayable due to ancient servers. Guaranteed frustration & rage with this game...not just from atrocious sbmm, but also from their terrible servers. Seriously, there are countless mobile games that have far better servers than this game. Pick up this game if you want to experience pure rage and frustration. 

Seriously, EA, Respawn, enough with new legends, enough with new maps, enough with new skins, just fix the hardware and coding associated with this deathly sick game. 

To potentially new players, I urge you to check to see if new servers have been put in before you pick up this game. Otherwise, agony awaits you!

Fix your f'ing shit respawn, I like this game but the constant connection errors every match and crashes every 1-2 matches is just depressing...

downvoting only for this given the rest of my experience has been fine

I used to have an absolute burning hate for this game for years. That is, until recently, I decided and was persuaded by a friend to try it and because it was free I said why not. Long story short, this game has more depth than I ever thought a Hero shooter could have and I am hooked on playing it at the moment! If only I hadn't been such a bum for the past few years!

Very nice game wasted with the worst servers i've ever experienced in my entire life. 
Between disconnections and lag, i don't think it's even worth to play ranked if it's to lose all your hard-earned RP.
Sadly, it seems that they close their eyes on this. Taking their community for granted and not willing to invest for a better user experience . Not surprising with EA, greedy.

almost 500 hours of playtime....im going out of my way to tell Respawn.....FIX YOUR GODDAMN SERVERS MR. DEVELOPER MAN!!!! this is like PUBG on Xbox early release BAD.  Edit; Season 11, servers are working as they should, no issues
!! thank god....and Ash got the gyroscopic thick robo hips tho!!!!

It seems that after EVERY SINGLE update the servers just shit the bed. Every single time. It would be forgivable if it happened just once every major patch, but no. Immediately after each patch or update, the servers just don't work. The fact that this keeps happening is just a lack of care. Any other job and they would've been fired for constantly fucking up, but no.  The devs care more about pushing cosmetic items than actually fixing their servers.

The game is fun and challenging with hardly any cheaters, REFRESHING!!! It is a good mix of getting gear(gathering), and 1st person shooter. The aiming takes a second to learn and be comfortable with, but once you dial it in you're good. There is a variety of characters and weapons to play. Find what works for you and get playing. The game takes a bit of strategy as well, knowing when to push and when to retreat and heal up.

Fun to play, I've been playing CoD: Warzone for a couple of years now and it's gotten so bad that it is unplayable now. I've came over to Apex Legends for 2 days now and just everything is smoother and more fun and way better at matchmaking imo, I think from now on this is going to be my go to for a battle royale game.

About the only thing I even complain about is probably the size of the maps and if you're not familiar with the map as well as others... you're picked off easily and quickly and that makes it kind of frustrating. Other then that I always recommend the game to anyone who asks.

Pretty smooth gameplay while in game. not any HUGE bugs that you run into. however the pre game lobby barely functions. it crashes constantly and breaks anytime you change game mode I still like playing it though so that says something

9/10*Titanfall2
7/10*Apex legends
For sure it's a good game(Titanfall2), good gun, best idea and amazing gameplay. that's why I love it, For apex I think the server needs to be fixed, especially at the beginning of every season.It's the most important of Apex legends.

Fast paced game.
Hardcore at higher levels with quite few cheaters from time to time
Hard game to pick up if your new but experience will come with time
split second discisions make the difference between life and death
on bad days if u loose more then 3 ranked games  in a row just chill go do some other stuff and return sometimes while climbing you'll get stuck but just keep improving youll soon climb out
can't stress the importance of coms and if you can find a group of friends to play with
Overall a fun game.

this game is a waste of fucking space so many problems from, sound problems were you wont even hear someone right next to you pulling the trigger until to late. to meta fucks sweaty comps never changing guns just using the same sad guns over and over. The characters sad excuses of a shitty game the keep the relivent meta guys good and nerf people that never had a problem. its fucking sad seeing they wont fix a problem in a game for 3 months but they will release 23 new skins that also have bugs most of the time but they wont do a hotfix to make it right they will wait months to do anything fuck this shitty game.

I have already recommended this game to many friends and they took my advice. However I have put so much money into my console account, which pricing for items is a whole other thing, but to loose all those items when switching to pc is so demotivating. I genuinely almost quit this game.

Between constant server issues and Devs not knowing what they want the meta to be and just outright maniacal matchmaking. This game hasn't been peak in a long time. My 150 hours on steam record is not accurate. I played it when it first released on xbox. Then PC on Origin, and now have it on steam, and just in general feel the game has reached near life cycle end. Just shelf it and work on titanfall 3 at this point.

its worth is exactly what you can expect from a free game. Lacking in anything that makes a game truly a game. There is no heart here. Little story and worst of all, an area style game that so many other companies have jumped on the band wagon on that it's borderline shameful if it wasn't excepted. Much like other clones of this type, it lacks any real meaningful difference genre save for one, "supers". Much like overwatch and games like league of legends that adds a different spin to combat that can turn the tables of combat from the attackers to defenders. Other then that, its a colorful clone of any other arena that drops people in. Though, it could be stated that any given genre can only be expanded so much. However, this is made by the same people as titan fall and titans are even referenced in game. An ability to be able to call that in or ANYTYHING ELSE would be interesting. another great idea for the game would ditch the flying altogether. it boring as hell as everyone does it. want to be different? figure out a better spawn mechanic. Teleportation would be an interesting idea that could be used to add spontaneous spawn to add more chaos to the battlefield.

I have spent 800 h and got all DLCs from this game. The game content itself, though with a lot of bugs, frankly speaking, is still pretty good. But the deeper you delve into the game the clearer you realise the violence from internet. I got endless racism and sexual harassments. Let alone the countless swear words you receive from your teamates every game.  You maybe get this from other popular games but with this game it's by far the worst. Worse than LOL, dota, CS:go etc.  I cannot mend the wounds they've carved into my heart. Thus I will leave this game forever and leave these warnings to you. Oh and forgot to send a big thank you to all the hackers. Thank you for ending my game in 1sec, so I can leave the game with peace and don't have to suffer from my teamates anymore. (Literally 1 hacker per game, you can do better Anti Cheat Client. What a joke)

What started off as a casual play a game here play a game there, something clicked with me one day. this is hands down my favourite shooter of all time. The mobility alone is addictive and the gun play is just *Chefs Kiss*. If you're on the fence still or it hasn't just clicked yet, it will.

Solid Game

Just coming back to shooters after almost 10 years now that my rural internet can handle it. 
The Good.
The game is fun first of all. The gun play top notch. Last shooter I enjoyed this much was Unreal Tournament GOTY edition in the early 90s. The legends are well rounded, I am surprised by how much. It appears to have a deep backstory though I care little for lore in this type of game. The avatars are very "politically correct" so I assume the back stories are progressive as well. If this offends you, consider this a warning. The maps are sexy as are the avatars you control. New content often.
The Bad (possibly).
The player base in Pubs can be pretty toxic but I went in expecting this. The skill cap is also high, lots of sweats running around, the player base as a whole has skills. The store shop can be expensive if you are a completion type of person with the extra digital toys, but it is not pay to win in any way. Servers can be a little shabby at patch times surprisingly for such a large company. Cheating exist pretty liberally late at night or in ranked play especially.  Better get some buddies eventually or you will hit a wall in your upward momentum, its a team game at heart.

I would like to see more investment in club play such as badges for clubs, rankings, even logos. Something to make me wanna join a group. I hope they build on the new Arena setup. Right now its pretty much used by me to warm up.

Apex is a good game however unlocking new characters is very grindy unless you want to spend a ridiculous amount of money. To unlock all characters through the in game currency you currently need to hit level 200. It also takes the average player 2-3 matches to level once. I'm 15 hours in and have only hit level 11. I also wish they would introduce a solo game mode. From what i can tell there is no penalty to players leaving in the middle of a match for either Arena or Battle Royal which can be a bit frustrating when people constantly leave.

If you like it you'll put up with the games faults, otherwise its just a rage fest.

The best battle royal I have played and the new season is expanding the game vastly. The cast of characters are great and the gunplay and gameplay as a whole is a league above any other BR. Very much worth a spin, assuming you are ok with the game type and the class bases shooter nature of the game. Also realize this is not titanfall and you can't wall run bro.

EOMM+/-SBMM makes it less than fun. Non-ranked games are full of even more high level players than a platinum game; ranked shouldn't be the easier option. Cross platform to include controler-users has only made it worse, now that person hitting you from 200 yards with a 99 can be a hacker, a controler player, or a pred and there seems to be no way to have a fair game. Back in season 3 I remember vicious, hard-fought battles that would go back and forth. Now, you get lasered by some controler or hacker who has crap movement and bad positioning, through the 1' gap in wood from 350m, when they just shot you on the other side of the building. Not to mention the number of people who play bloodhound to hide their walling. This game went from fun to trash.

This game is at the best place it's been in years (minus the wattson nerf). The gunplay is great, The devs are always updating and adding new content to game, different maps and modes as well for good variety. Cannot complain a little bit for a battle royale style game. A good break from the monotony of space trucking in Elite Dangerous (also a good game, recommended)

Have over 1k hours on Origin, didn't want to switch but did it anyway to Steam since Origin is kind of *meh*.

AND

I have a love-hate relationship with this game, still have fun tho and Wraith is best girl.

Pretty good especially with friends even if you dont like BRs. Servers are pretty whack tho and skins are overpriced cause EA but i mean its mostly earn-able and the games free so i dont mind too much.

Just bare boned skin shopping events, we need something new soon or its gonna tire out. Still waiting for the promised LTM we never got in War Games last year.

Use to play on the X-box, came to PC and it is like a new game. Movement is unreal, gun play is different class.
I wasn't a fan of BRs having battle passes but Apex use it well, having skins that are nice to look at and also show who has played for a while.
Very good game.

lots of fun, i found it to be a bit difficult at first but you just need to pay attention to whether or not you should go for certain fights. knowing when to hold back and when to push is just as important as having snappy aim. people can be rude and annoying in the game chat but you just need to ignore those or mute them before the game starts.

the fact that nothing fucking works correctly is so amazing to me and i love that so much it gives me high hopes for future games being that epic is a multi million dollar company and still cant develope a properly good game and everytime i play this i want to commit suicide from the mier fact that the learning curve of the game is straighter than the pole the developers mom dances on.

Great Game, i think its one of the best Battle royals out there, and where you see less cheaters. Even if 3rd parties are kind of a pain in the ass, the game is really fun. better to play with friends. Apex coins are too expensive tho. great game events.

Have played PUBG, played Fortnite, played older CoDs and SOCOM games. Reason why I give that bit first, is so people can understand that I have experienced something other than Apex. 
All that said, I do recommend this game. The gunplay feels better here than Fortnite. Plus, no building. An for whatever reason, it just doesn't feel as tense as PUBG did for me. 
I really like the game. Though I will say it is definitely more fun with friends. 

It's free. Give it a chance like I did. What's the harm?

Played it when it first came out and there were only like 5 characters... was not too impressed and lost interest after about 20 matches... Honestly with everything they have added in the last 2 years I am very excited to get back into this game. I knew the game had potential and was pleased with the original map, not sure why it didn't keep my attention initially. The game comes off not only very graphically polished, but I find it incredibly well balanced with lots of crazy tricks to each characters special and ultimate. Also, HAPPY 2ND ANNIVERSARY to the Dev team!

DO NOT SPEND ANY MONEY ON THIS GAME. THERE HAS BEEN A BUG AFFECTING A LARGE NUMBER OF PLAYERS THAT PREVENTS YOU FROM LOGGING IN. EA'S SOLUTION IS TO TELL YOU TO JUST MAKE A NEW ACCOUNT, EVEN THOUGH YOU PUT TIME AND MONEY INTO THE LOCKED ACCOUNT. THIS BUG HAS GONE ON FOR OVER A MONTH AND EA/RESPAWN HAVE NOT EVEN ACKNOWLEDGED IT IS THEIR FAULT.

You have to be good at it for it to be fun. It is a very strategical game that will make you think. In Apex you cant just run straight into a fight and hope for the best like Warzone, you have to plan out how your going to get to the guy and how your going to use your ultimates when your fighting the guy. So I think if you know how to do these things and put time into the game it is a very fun game that you'll love.

Very fun Battle Royale. Very nice movement and weapon system.

A lot to learn and improve on, you'll get most likely stomped the first few hundred games.

Play it with friends, and try to not get tilted when getting stomped by preds or no-lifes. Actual "training" inside and outside (stuff like aimlab) can help you to improve, but not overnight. Keep pushing and playing, and you too will be an APEX PREDATOR someday.

I've played since the beginning, but decided to purchase a DLC unlock pack on Steam (and to ditch Origin).

Respawn's queues are console-like BS.  They decide to use a two hour map rotation that forces everyone to play on World's Edge, the worst map in the game.  They have 4 queues to chose from (trios, duos, seasonal, and ranked) and for 2 hours of every 4, you can only play on a map you hate.  Okay, but what if you like World's Edge?  The stupid map rotation system is eventually going to lock you into a map you hate as well.  It's a ridiculous cynical system that suggests not enough people will play unless they throw everyone into the same queues, but then they wonder why there are mass exoduses of players, like there was in Season 3 when they introduced Worlds Edge.

Don't spend any money on this game until Respawn lets you play the game you want to play.

ok so its a good game yeah, pretty decent balancing, heros and guns alike. id say the only thing just horrible about it is the new map that came out, there are so many choke points in the map players can just wait for easy kills. which in its self wouldnt be that big of an issue if the circle didnt shove players down forced paths with drop offs on some sides. my personal opinion is kings canyon was just way better, and this new map has too many high ground choke points that kinda screw you over if youre not the first team to them. where as kings canyon was a little more open with the choke points being the canyon areas which didnt feel all that bad to actually play in.

I currently have 492 hours played through the Origin Launcher while I start to accrue the same amount of hours through the Steam client.  Apex Legends in a nutshell?  Titanfall universe, crisp and snappy gunplay, surprisingly deep lore, one of the best battle royales to date, and a responsive developer that listens to their players.  What more could you ask for?

****Edit - Hadn't played since the beginning of Season 8 and my account was hacked and evidently banned.  EA has done nothing for me and multitudes of others to assist in recovering my account and will not give me any info on the ban.  This complete customer disservice is the straw that breaks the camel's back for me with this game and everything EA.  Sorry Respawn.

Excellent game, now is a great time to get in and try this game, it's VERY fun and intense. i had an easy time learning the game but there is a TON to master. the feeling of your first win is incredible.
